content.rendered:
What is an Agricultural Engineer?

Agricultural Engineers are engineers that focus on integrating farming with tech. Agricultural Engineers help create technology to aid in making farming safe and environmentally friendly.

Where does an Agricultural Engineer work?

  • Government offices
  • Engineering firms
  • Worksites, both indoors and outdoors

How much do Agricultural Engineers make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an Agricultural Engineer is $42,300.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Agricultural Engineers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing agricultural engineering jobs.

  • Engineering majors
  • Biochemistry majors
  • Biosystems engineering majors
Explore Agricultural Engineering job opportunities on Handshake.

Agricultural Engineer skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Agricultural Engineers succeed in their work:

  • Understandings of both science and engineering
  • Strong communication skills
  • Design skills

What are some common questions about Agricultural Engineers?

Q: What are some career options for agricultural engineering majors?

A: With a degree in agricultural engineering there are many doors that can be opened. Some roles included are: food processing environmental systems, and structural design.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, and common path after college to becoming an Agricultural Engineer.
